page.title: 20THE VILLAGE SHOP
page.content: The village shop is seriously threatened. Each of the three housing areas has a neighbourhood service centre.The retail outlets deal mainly with 'convenience' goods which require frequent short journeys.Prices tend to be higher than in the town centre supermarkets.Therefore most people, owning a car, will tend to prefer the in-town shops.The regular customers are usually the old and the infirm who lack transport and purchasing power.The local shop does however provide a friendly personal service which is also a social benefit for these people.Baginton has an old type combined store comprising a Post Office, a newsagents and a grocers.
